cluster_relations.rel_desc: Forensic technological advancements improve the accuracy of forensic analysis.
remarks: Refers back to previously mentioned tools like SEM and mass spectrometry as part of advancements.

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Forensic technological advancements improve the reliability of forensic analysis.
Advancing forensic technology enhances the sophistication and effectiveness of the art of forensic science.
remarks: Technology entity represents 'forensic technology and technological advancements' derived from 'As technology continues to advance'.

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Development of new techniques improves the art of forensic science.

args.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject causes an increase in the quality, performance, or effectiveness of the object.
args.justification: All four relations describe a causal positive impact where technological advances or new techniques make some aspect of forensic practice (accuracy, reliability, or overall art of forensic science) better. Despite wording differences like 'improves' vs 'enhances', the underlying predicate is the same: the subject improves the object.

Each relation captures how a method or technology influences the quality or effectiveness of forensic analysis or practice (accuracy, reliability, sophistication, effectiveness). Grouping them under a shared class focused on quality/effectiveness impact provides a reusable family for similar predicates like improves/enhances.

In all instances, the subject is the cause of improved quality or effectiveness of the object (technological advances or techniques lead to better forensic outcomes). This is best modeled as a causal impact rather than mere association.
